children.name: to send sth to sb after it has come to you
forward x
children.definition: forward/ˈfɔːʳwəʳd/  to send something to another person after it has come to you, so that they can deal with it: chuyển tiếp
examples: ▪ i asked the landlord to forward all my mail, but he didn’t.
tôi đã yêu cầu chủ nhà chuyển tiếp tất cả mail của tôi nhưng anh ấy đã không làm.
forward sth to sb
▪ after the report had been translated, it was forwarded to admiral turner.
sau khi bản báo cáo được dịch, nó được chuyển tiếp cho admiral turner.
forward sb sth
▪ could you forward me her email, and i’ll get back to her.
bạn có thể chuyển tiếp cho tôi email của cô ấy và tôi sẽ liên lạc sau với cô ấy?
forwardverb[ t ] chuyểntiếp
to send a letter, etc., especially from someone's old address to their new
address, or to send a letter, email, etc. that you have received to someone else
_i'll forward any mailtoyour new address.
_i'll forward his email to you if you're interested.

children.name: misdirect x
children.definition: misdirectverb ghi sai địa chỉ (thư từ, kiện hàng...)
examples: to send something to the wrong place or aim something in the wrong direction
_my luggage was misdirectedtoa different airport.
_vilas misdirected the shot, and the ball went over the net.

children.name: send on x
children.definition: send on to send someone’s letters or possessions to them at their new address because they have moved house: gửi đền/ về
examples: send on something
▪ i promised that i’d send on her final salary cheque.
send something on (to somebody)
▪ if any letters arrive, please send them on to me in los angeles.

children.name: send back b1
children.definition: send back/returna2  to send sth back to the person who sent it.returnis more formal thansendbackand is used especially in writing.: gửi lại
examples: she sent all patrick’s letters back without opening them.
complete all the details, then send back the form.
return sth (to sb)
i would be grateful if you would sign the attached copy of this letter and return it to me.

children.name: redirect x
children.definition: redirect/ˌriːdaɪˈrekt, -d-/  to write someone’s new address on a letter or parcel that has arrived for them, and send it to them: chuyển tiếp
examples: ▪ i’ve asked the new owners to redirect all our letters.
tôi yêu cầu những người chủ mới chuyển tiếp tất cả những lá thư của chúng tôi
redirect something to something: chuyển tiếp cái gì đến cái gì
▪ i’m redirecting all his letters to his college.
tôi đang chuyển tiếp tất cả lá thư của anh ấy tới trường đại học của anh ấy.

children.name: enclosure x
children.definition: enclosure sth that is put inside an envelope with a letter: đính kèm

children.name: stamp a2
children.definition: stamp/ postage stampformal  a small piece of paper with a picture or pattern on it which is stuck onto a letter or parcel before it is posted to show that postage has been paid for
examples: i stuck a 50p stamp on the envelope.
richard collects stamps.
a second-class stamp

children.name: mail a2
children.definition: postuk/mailespecially us  letters, papers, parcels etc that are sent and delivered using the postal system: bưu phẩm
examples: was there any post for me today?
emma wasopeningherpost.
i picked up the mail -- no letters, only bills today.
there was a pile of mail and a number of telephone messages waiting for victor.
when the post came, she searched anxiously for his scrawled handwriting.
was there any post for me this morning?

children.name: parcel b1
children.definition: parcelespecially ukan object that has been wrapped in paper or put in a special envelope, especially so that it can be sent by post
examples: the parcel was delivered last week.
he sends regular food parcels to his family in libya.
parcel of
a parcel of clothes and blankets
package[c] b2 sth wrapped in paper, packed in a box, and then sent by mail or delivered
there’s a package here for a miami lakes address.

children.name: mail a2
children.definition: mailespecially usthe system of collecting and delivering letters and packages :
examples: the mail here’s really slow and unreliable.
the product will be sold mainly through the mail.
in the mail
i’ll put the check in the mail tomorrow.
by mail
did you send the document by mail?
registered/express/first-class etc mail
i sent my application by registered mail.
most reports are sent viainternal mail(= a system of sending documents to people inside the same organization ).
post[u]ukthe official system for carrying letters, packages etc from one place to anothersyn mail
by post
the winners will be notified by post.
in the post
your letter must have gotlost in the post.
i’llputa copy of the bookin the post(= send it ).
through the post
a parcel arrived through the post.
send sth by postthey sent me the contract by post.
put sth in the post(= put it in a box to be collected )i put it in the post on friday, so it should have arrived today.
get sth in the post(= receive it )did you get anything in the post today?
sth comes/arrives in the postthis letter came in the post this morning.
sth gets lost in the posti'm afraid the cheque must have got lost in the post.
first-class postthe package arrived by first-class post.
second-class postitems sent by second-class post can take up to five days to arrive.

children.name: enclose b2
children.definition: enclose bỏ kèm theo; gửi kèm theo (trong phong bì, bưu kiện...)
examples: to send something in the same envelope or parcel as something else
enclose sth
please enclose a curriculum vitae with your letter of application.
i'veencloseda few photos i though you might enjoy
an enclosed sth
please find theenclosed photos of two products.
sth enclosed
judging from the astonishing photos enclosed, this is no surprise.

children.name: address c2
children.definition: address to write a name or address on an envelope or parcel : ghi địa chỉ
examples: the parcel was wrongly addressed.
address sth to sb
that letter was addressed to me.
send astamped, self-addressed envelope(= with your address on it so it can be sent back to you ).
so why did you open a letter that was addressedtome?
readdress[ t ] to write a different address on an envelope because the person it is intended for has moved to another place : thay địa chỉ
we readdressed all his letterstoaustralia for years after he had emigrated.
misaddress[ t ] to put the wrong address on a letter or parcel : viết sai địa chỉ
we have now corrected the error in our computer records which resulted in our letters to you being misaddressed.

children.name: zip code x
children.definition: zip code in the us, a series of numbers that forms part of an address, and which is used to help organizepost so that it can be delivered more quickly
examples: postcode[ c ] uk in britain, a short series of letters and numbers that is part of an address, and shows exactly where a place is

children.name: post office a2
children.definition: post office a place where stamps are sold and from where letters and parcels are sent : bưu điện
examples: the post office will hold my mail for me while i'm away

children.name: mailbox x
children.definition: postboxuk/ letterboxuk/mailboxus  a box in a public place, into which you put letters that you want to send : hộp thư, hòm thư (nơi công cộng)

children.name: addressee x
children.definition: addressee a person whose name or address is written on a letter or parcel : người nhận

children.name: consignee x
children.definition: consignee formal the person something is sent to : người nhận
examples: goods must be signed for by the consignee.

children.name: sender x
children.definition: sender the person who sent a particular letter, package, message etc :
examples: postage stamps were introduced in britain in 1840 as a way of showing that the sender had paid for the letter to be delivered.
the letter came back with' return to sender- not known at this address' written on it.

children.name: send a1
children.definition: send to arrange for sth to go or be taken to another place, especially by post :
examples: lyn sent some pictures of the wedding.
send sb sth
we sent mom flowers for mother’s day.
we sent her a letter of apology.
send sth to sb/sth
i’ll send a copy to you.
send sth back/ up/ over etc
he ordered coffee to be sent up.
send sth by post/ sea/ air etc
monday is the last day to send cards by post to arrive by christmas.

children.name: register x
children.definition: register when you register a letter or parcel, you send it using a special postal service, so that it will be dealt with in a special way and not be lost : gửi bảo đảm
examples: a registeredletter
did you register the parcel?

children.name: dispatch x
children.definition: dispatch/ despatch formal to send sth to sb, especially sth they haveorderedor are expecting: chuyển
examples: the seller had agreed to dispatch the goods free of charge.
goods are normally dispatched within 24 hours.
dispatch sth to sb
two loads of woollen cloth were dispatched to the factory on december 12th.
dispatch sth to sth
the proofs were then despatched to london for printing.

children.name: send off b2
children.definition: send off to send sth somewhere so that it can be dealt with:
examples: send sth off/send off sth
i must send this film off to be processed.
when did you send off your application form?
have you sent off your application form yet?

children.name: consign x
children.definition: consignformalto send something somewhere, especially in order to sell it : chuyển giao
examples: the goods have been consignedtoyou by air.

children.name: get sth off x
children.definition: get sth off informalto send sth by mail, especially when it is urgent: chuyển gấp
examples: she managed to get all the letters off before five o'clock.
i got that letter off this morning.
get sth off to
i’ll get this off to you first thing in the morning.

children.name: express x
children.definition: express mainly us to send sth somewhere very quickly : gửi hoả tốc
examples: your order will be expressedtoyou within 24 hours.

children.name: mail a2
children.definition: postuk /mailespecially us  to send a letter, package etc by putting it in a letter box or taking it to the post office:gửi
examples: i must remember to post joey’s birthday card.
you may choose not to mail the payment until the due date.
post/mail sth to sb
could you mail those photographs to me?
tickets will be posted to you unless otherwise requested.
post/mail sb sth
i mailed my dad a postcard from alaska.

children.name: send in x
children.definition: send in to send something to an organization, usuallyby mail,so that it can be dealt with :gửi (đên một tổ chức)
examples: send sth in : gửi cái gì đi
we’ve sent our passports in to get them renewed.
send in sth
the final date for sending in completed application forms is july 3rd.
almost 1000 questionnaires have already been sent in.

children.name: send out x
children.definition: send out to send something to a lot of people, usually by mail:gửi (cho nhiều người)
examples: send out sth
the club sends out a monthly newsletter to all its members.
officials are sending out information packs to 4000 firms in the area.
send sth out
we posted the wedding invitations in batches, rather than sending them all out at the same time.

children.name: put sth in the post u
children.definition: put sth in the postukto put a letter, parcel etc into a post box or take it to a post office to be sent:gửi cái gì bằng bưu điện
examples: i’ll put a cheque in the post for you tonight.

children.name: messenger x
children.definition: messenger sb who takes a message or whose job it is to take messages: người đưa tin
examples: in the late afternoon a messenger arrived to inform me that the chief was on his way.
captain anderson did not come himself, but sent a messenger instead.
the king’s messenger stayed in rome for further talks.
messenger boy
when he was sixteen alan got a job as a messenger boy in an advertising agency.

children.name: courier x
children.definition: courier sb whose job it is to carry urgent messages, letters, parcels etc, especially for a company: người đưa thư
examples: a courier arrived with the documents just before the meeting.
send sth by courier
he said he’d be sending the report over by courier.

children.name: go-between x
children.definition: go-between sb who takes messages between two people or groups because they are not able to meet or do not want to meet: người trung gian
examples: barnes isn’t involved in the deal - he’s just the go-between.
act as (a) go-between
simon was not a member of either group so he seemed a good candidate to act as a go-between.

children.name: postman b1
children.definition: postmanuk (ukinformalpostie,usmailman) sb whose job is to deliver and collect letters and parcels that are sent by post :người đưa thư

children.name: deliveryman x
children.definition: deliveryman a man who delivers goods to people's houses or places of work :ngườigiao hàng
